overview:
Eric Franchi currently serves as head of publisher development for Undertone. In this role, he is responsible for all facets of Undertone’s digital media portfolio. This includes overseeing relationships with 400+ premium publishers including ABC, Sony, Gannett, Hearst and CBS, adoption of display, video, high impact and mobile, supply platform partnerships, and all inventory management operations. Under Eric’s strategic direction, Undertone has grown into a top 20 comScore display and video network while achieving recognition by Doubleverify, AdSafe and Trustmetrics for industry leading quality and brand safety.

Since co-founding Undertone in 2002, Eric has held several key roles for the company. This includes head of business development, where he was responsible for new revenue via strategic partnerships. Prior to that Eric was Undertone’s first head of national sales, where he led the transition of Undertone into its current premium model, grew Undertone’s national sales team footprint, launched new products and established key agency and advertiser relationships. He contributed to the company’s fund-raising efforts, which resulted in a strategic investment by JMI equity in 2008. As a member of the company’s executive team, he assists in the strategic direction and management of the overall business.

Eric is also a frequent speaker at industry events including the OMMA, Digiday, iMedia and IAB conferences; his writing has been featured in industry publications such as AdExchanger and MediaPost.
